text: Zohreh Tabibzadeh-Nouri () is an Iranian dentist and conservative politician who was formerly a member of the Parliament of Iran representing Tehran, Rey, Shemiranat and Eslamshahr. She was appointed by Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as the head of Center for Women and Family Affairs. ==References== Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Members of the 9th Islamic Consultative Assembly Category:Deputies of Tehran, Rey, Shemiranat and Eslamshahr Category:Front of Islamic Revolution Stability politicians Category:Women dentists Category:Members of the Women's fraction of Islamic Consultative Assembly Category:Office for Strengthening Unity members Category:21st-century women politicians
title: Zohreh Tabibzadeh-Nouri
